```{r import}

library(data.table)
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(zoo)

LGR.temp.1993to2003<-read_csv(here::here("Examples/data", "rivermg_1703019523_114.csv"))
  
LGR.temp.2004to2018<-read_csv(here::here("Examples/data", "rivermg_1703019549_803.csv"))

LGR.temp.raw<-cbind(LGR.temp.1993to2003,LGR.temp.2004to2018)

LGR.temp.data <- LGR.temp.raw %>%
  # mutate(across(everything(), ~ifelse(.=="", NA, as.character(.)))) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(2:27),
    names_to = "ID",
    values_to = "value"
  ) %>%
  separate(ID, c("CY", "LGR", "ID")) %>%
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = "ID",
    values_from = "value"
  ) %>%
  mutate_at(c("tempc"), as.numeric) %>%
  separate(1, c("mm", "dd")) %>%
  mutate(
    CY = as.numeric(CY),
    mm = as.numeric(mm),
    dd = as.numeric(dd)
  ) %>%
  arrange(CY) %>% # sort data to use rollmean
  group_by(CY) %>%
  filter(complete.cases(tempc)) %>% #remove any days without temp (following JG's code) -update for age of return?
  mutate(
    LGR.temp = rollmean(tempc, k = 7, fill = NA, align = "right"), #same as JG code, returns NA for 7 day average with NA's present
    LGR.temp.apply = rollapply(tempc, width = 7, FUN = function(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE), by = 1, by.column = TRUE, partial = TRUE, fill = NA, align = "right") #adjusts for NA's within d7 averages
  ) %>%
  mutate(YMD = lubridate::ymd(paste(CY, mm, dd, sep = "-"))) %>%
  mutate(DOY = lubridate::yday(YMD)) %>%
 # select("CY","mm", "DOY", "LGR.temp") %>%
  mutate(
    CY = as.character(CY),
    DOY = as.character(DOY)
  )


#merge with larger dataset




```
